title: Los Angeles Rams could hire Aaron Kromer as their offensive line coach
text:
Los Angeles Rams could hire Aaron Kromer as their offensive line coach Los Angeles Rams could hire Aaron Kromer as their offensive line coach By Bryan Kalbrosky 5 hours ago 102 shares By: Bryan Kalbrosky | 5 hours ago 
Reports indicated the Los Angeles Rams were interested in hiring Aaron Kromer as the offensive coordinator , but he may have a different gig. 
While Kromer most recently coached as the offensive line coach for the Buffalo Bills, he has experience as an offensive coordinator for the Chicago Bears. Aaron Kromer is here in Mobile with the #Rams contingent. He's going to be their offensive line coach. 
— Tom Pelissero (@TomPelissero) January 24, 2017 
The Rams recently hired Greg Olson, who the team was linked to as a potential offensive coordinator, as their quarterback coach. 
As such, McVay (who turned 31 today) is adding necessary experience to his coaching staff. Related: Jaguars offensive coordinator Greg Olson will become the Rams QB coach 
In addition to gigs with the Bears and Bills, he has also worked with various other NFL teams as well. 
The Bills had one of the better offensive line units in football this season and it’s one of the biggest needs for Los Angeles ( via Pro Football Focus ). 
Kromer was the interim head coach for the New Orleans Saints in 2012. Additionally, he coached their offensive line for multiple seasons and was also briefly their running backs coach. 
He was a senior assistant and offensive line coach for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and was also an offensive line coach for the Oakland Raiders and Northwestern. Related:
